DataElement.preferredName: Person Intrahepatic Portal Vein Invasion Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Present Absent Text Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the present/absent indicator whether macrovascular invasion, movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type, of the intrahepatic portal vein, the short thick trunk vein that transports blood containing the absorbed products of digestion from the intestine directly to the liver, being present as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Intrahepatic Portal Vein Invasion Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to microvascular invasion, movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type, of the intrahepatic portal vein, the short thick trunk vein that transports blood containing the absorbed products of digestion from the intestine directly to the liver, being present as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Intrahepatic Portal Vein Invasion Present Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: (in-tra-hep-AT-ik) Within the liver.:A short thick trunk vein that transports blood containing the absorbed products of digestion from the intestine directly to the liver.:The movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A short thick trunk vein that transports blood containing the absorbed products of digestion from the intestine directly to the liver.
The movement of one cell type into an area normally occupied by a different cell type.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Confirmation that a condition or event is present or absent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.

Concepts.definition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
